node.title: F.W. De Klerk, Former South African President Who Dismantled Apartheid, Dies at 85
node.alt: F.W. de Klerk and Nelson Mandela in 1994. They shared the Nobel Peace Prize for negotiating the end of the apartheid state.
node.description: A prominent Afrikaner, he was the ninth and possibly last in a long line of white presidents of South Africa.
node.content: ["F.W. de Klerk, the ninth, and possibly last, in a long line of white presidents of South Africa, who dramatically dismantled the apartheid system that he and his ancestors had helped put in place, died at his home in South Africa on Thursday. He was 85. ", "The former president\u2019s death was confirmed by the F.W. de Klerk Foundation, which said in a statement that he passed away at his home in Fresnaye, a suburb of Cape Town, after being diagnosed with cancer.", "A member of a prominent Afrikaner family, Mr. de Klerk had vehemently defended the separation of the races during his long climb up the political ladder. But once he took over as president in 1989, he stunned his deeply divided nation, and the wider world, by reconsidering South Africa\u2019s racist ways, a step that won him and Nelson Mandela, whom he released from prison, the Nobel Peace Prize."]
